abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental pre-audit
            assessment of seventeen public enterprises in the Republic
            of Guinea-Bissau that are being privatized under the Private
            Sector Rehabilitation and Restructuring Project. It aims to
            provide the necessary information for internal planning
            before divestiture and for external reporting as well as
            indicating the "road map" for determining the
            environmental liabilities and audit studies for future
            privatization candidates. The major environmental issues of
            concern in Guinea-Bissau include deforestation, soil
            degradation, overgrazing, and over-fishing. The
            industrialization could become accelerated through the
            privatization of public enterprises. This could give rise to
            critical and most immediate problems: a) health impacts of
            pollution derived from inadequate water supply and shortage
            of electricity; b) poor sanitation, drainage, and solid
            waste services; c) Poor urban and industrial waste
            management; d) air pollution; and e) noise pollution. In
            general, there is relatively low coverage and access to
            basic services. Controlled landfills, incineration, and
            resource recovery facilities are few. Hence, health and
            safety issues, including medical monitoring and providing
            appropriate industrial hygiene for workers, will be
            necessary to minimize the negative impacts.
